intro: Benthamia perfecunda, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant has small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
